style_guidelines.sentence_structure: Use active voice. Limit sentences to 25 words. Avoid jargon unless technically necessary.
style_guidelines.paragraph_length: Maximum 4-5 sentences per paragraph. Use whitespace for readability.
style_guidelines.terminology: Use Microsoft-approved product names. Capitalize Azure service names consistently.
style_guidelines.perspective: Write from customer benefit perspective. Lead with business outcomes before technical features.

competitive_disparagement: direct negative comparisons to named competitors
claims that competitors are inadequate or inferior

mandatory_disclaimers.performance_claims: Performance results are based on internal Microsoft testing and may vary. Actual performance depends on configuration, workload characteristics, and other factors.
mandatory_disclaimers.cost_estimates: Pricing examples are illustrative. Actual costs depend on usage patterns, selected tiers, and regional pricing. Refer to Azure Pricing Calculator for specific estimates.
mandatory_disclaimers.sla_references: Service level agreements are subject to terms and conditions. Refer to Azure SLA documentation for specific coverage details.
mandatory_disclaimers.preview_features: Preview features are provided without service level agreement and may have limited support. Preview features should not be used for production workloads without risk assessment.
mandatory_disclaimers.third_party_integration: Integration with third-party services is subject to those services' terms and availability. Microsoft does not warrant third-party service performance.
mandatory_disclaimers.compliance_certifications: Compliance certifications apply to Azure platform services. Customer applications inherit compliance posture based on configuration. Customers are responsible for their use of Azure services in regulated environments.

customer_data_protection: Never reference actual customer names without written approval and executed case study agreement
Do not disclose specific usage metrics from customer environments
Anonymize all customer scenarios unless public case study exists
Obtain legal review for any content mentioning customer implementation details
Do not reference customer security configurations or vulnerabilities

data_handling_statements.azure_openai: Customer prompts and completions processed through Azure OpenAI Service are not available to other customers or used to improve Microsoft or third-party models.
data_handling_statements.cognitive_search: Data indexed in Azure Cognitive Search remains within customer-designated resources and is not used for service improvement.
data_handling_statements.telemetry: Azure Monitor telemetry is customer-owned data subject to customer-configured retention and access policies.

prohibited_content: Screenshots or data from customer environments without consent
Customer contact information or organizational structures
Specific customer budget or spending data

avoid_exaggeration: Do not overstate capabilities or market position
Use measured language for competitive positioning
Support forward-looking statements with reasonable basis
Acknowledge limitations and constraints where relevant
Use quantitative claims only when substantiated by data
avoid_emotional_overreach: Minimize superlatives (amazing, incredible, revolutionary) unless contextually justified
Avoid fear-based messaging or urgency manipulation
Do not use emotional appeals that undermine rational decision-making
Maintain professional distance; avoid casual or informal language
technical_accuracy_requirements: Verify all technical specifications against current product documentation
Distinguish between features in general availability vs. preview
Accurately represent service limitations and constraints
Use precise terminology for technical concepts
Cite performance benchmarks with methodology context
inclusive_language: Avoid gendered language when referring to users or roles
Use person-first language for accessibility references
Avoid cultural idioms that may not translate globally
Ensure examples represent diverse industries and geographies

mandatory_review_scenarios: Comparative advertising mentioning competitors by name
Content targeting regulated industries (healthcare, finance, government)
Content discussing security vulnerabilities or incidents
Content for use in contracts or formal proposals
expedited_review_available: Minor updates to previously approved content

regional_compliance_notes.EMEA: Content must acknowledge GDPR compliance for data processing. Reference data residency options for regulated data.
regional_compliance_notes.APAC: Be aware of local data sovereignty requirements in Australia, China, and Singapore. Mention regional availability where relevant.
regional_compliance_notes.LATAM: Highlight Spanish and Portuguese language support. Reference local compliance certifications where available.
regional_compliance_notes.NA: Include references to HIPAA, SOC 2, and FedRAMP certifications for relevant audiences. Mention US-based data center options.

tier_1_product_descriptions.scope: Standard feature descriptions, technical specifications, use case examples without customer references

tier_2_competitive_positioning.scope: Competitive comparisons, performance claims, pricing discussions, market position statements

tier_3_customer_facing_assets.scope: Case studies, customer quotes, joint marketing materials, content for regulated industries
